div.p: Greetings. Some students coming from Bologna and going down to Saxony believed that these should be sent to you, dear brother, promptly. I received them gladly for the sake of our love, and because I have now found a reliable courier, I am sending them to Bern to our people. We live here, as always, in the grace of Christ. I could not write more. The courier hurried. All the brothers love you, all greet you. Farewell forever and commend me to Burgundy. ZÃ¼rich, December 6, 1550. Greet all the brothers, especially Gallasius and the excellent Farellus.
To the most illustrious man, Mr. Johannes Calvin, faithful pastor of the church of Geneva, his esteemed lord and brother, most dear and incomparable.
